radiographic_examinations.findings: Saccular aneurysm of the aorta, particularly of its right posterolateral lumen, with associated periaortic infiltration.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased size of the aneurysm after 30 days of treatment.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Abnormal F-18 FDG hypermetabolism in the right wall of the infrarenal abdominal aorta and periaortic space, suggesting active vascular infection.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased F-18 FDG uptake in the right wall of the infrarenal abdominal aorta and periaortic space one month after discharge, correlating with clinical improvement.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Nearly normalization of the F-18 FDG uptake.
